metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: AngularJS Expressions
AngularJS binds data to HTML using Expressions .
content.html: AngularJS binds data to HTML using Expressions.

content.text: AngularJS Expressions
AngularJS expressions can be written inside double braces: {{ expression }} .
content.html: AngularJS expressions can be written inside double braces: {{ expression }}.

content.text: AngularJS expressions can also be written inside a directive: ng-bind=" expression " .
content.html: AngularJS expressions can also be written inside a directive: ng-bind="expression".

content.text: AngularJS will resolve the expression, and return the result exactly where the expression is written.
content.html: AngularJS will resolve the expression, and return the result exactly where the expression is written.

content.text: AngularJS expressions are much like JavaScript expressions: They can contain literals, operators, and variables.
content.html: AngularJS expressions are much like JavaScript expressions: They can contain literals, operators, and variables.

content.text: Example {{ 5 + 5 }} or {{ firstName + " " + lastName }}
content.html: Example {{ 5 + 5 }} or {{ firstName + " " + lastName }}

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.6.9/angular.min.js"></script>
<body>

<div ng-app="">
  <p>My first expression: {{ 5 + 5 }}</p>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: If you remove the ng-app directive, HTML will display the expression as it is, without solving it:
content.html: If you remove the ng-app directive, HTML will display the expression as it is, without solving it:

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.6.9/angular.min.js"></script>
<body>

<div>
  <p>My first expression: {{ 5 + 5 }}</p>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: You can write expressions wherever you like, AngularJS will simply resolve the expression and return the result.
content.html: You can write expressions wherever you like, AngularJS will simply resolve the expression and return the result.

content.text: Example: Let AngularJS change the value of CSS properties.
content.html: Example: Let AngularJS change the value of CSS properties.

content.text: Change the color of the input box below, by changing its value:
content.html: Change the color of the input box below, by changing its value:

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="myCol='lightblue'">

<input style="background-color:{{myCol}}" ng-model="myCol">

</div>

content.text: AngularJS Numbers
AngularJS numbers are like JavaScript numbers:
content.html: AngularJS numbers are like JavaScript numbers:

content.code: Total in dollar: {{ quantity * cost }}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="quantity=1;cost=5">

<p>Total in dollar: {{ quantity * cost }}</p>

</div>

content.text: Same example using ng-bind :
content.html: Same example using ng-bind:

content.code: Total in dollar:
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="quantity=1;cost=5">

<p>Total in dollar: <span ng-bind="quantity * cost"></span></p>

</div>

content.text: Using ng-init is not very common. You will learn a better way to initialize data in the chapter about controllers.
content.html: Using ng-init is not very common. You will learn a better way to initialize data in the chapter about controllers.

content.text: AngularJS Strings
AngularJS strings are like JavaScript strings:
content.html: AngularJS strings are like JavaScript strings:

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="firstName='John';lastName='Doe'">

<p>The name is {{ firstName + " " + lastName }}</p>

</div>

content.text: Same example using ng-bind :
content.html: Same example using ng-bind:

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="firstName='John';lastName='Doe'">

<p>The name is <span ng-bind="firstName + ' ' + lastName"></span></p>

</div>

content.text: AngularJS Objects
AngularJS objects are like JavaScript objects:
content.html: AngularJS objects are like JavaScript objects:

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="person={firstName:'John',lastName:'Doe'}">

<p>The name is {{ person.lastName }}</p>

</div>

content.text: Same example using ng-bind :
content.html: Same example using ng-bind:

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="person={firstName:'John',lastName:'Doe'}">

<p>The name is <span ng-bind="person.lastName"></span></p>

</div>

content.text: AngularJS Arrays
AngularJS arrays are like JavaScript arrays:
content.html: AngularJS arrays are like JavaScript arrays:

content.code: The third result is {{ points[2] }}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="points=[1,15,19,2,40]">

<p>The third result is {{ points[2] }}</p>

</div>

content.text: Same example using ng-bind :
content.html: Same example using ng-bind:

content.code: The third result is
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="points=[1,15,19,2,40]">

<p>The third result is <span ng-bind="points[2]"></span></p>

</div>

content.text: AngularJS Expressions vs. JavaScript Expressions
Like JavaScript expressions, AngularJS expressions can contain literals, operators, and variables.
content.html: Like JavaScript expressions, AngularJS expressions can contain literals, operators, and variables.

content.text: Unlike JavaScript expressions, AngularJS expressions can be written inside HTML.
content.html: Unlike JavaScript expressions, AngularJS expressions can be written inside HTML.

content.text: AngularJS expressions do not support conditionals, loops, and exceptions, while JavaScript expressions do.
content.html: AngularJS expressions do not support conditionals, loops, and exceptions, while JavaScript expressions do.

content.text: AngularJS expressions support filters, while JavaScript expressions do not.
content.html: AngularJS expressions support filters, while JavaScript expressions do not.

content.text: Learn about JavaScript in our JavaScript Tutorial .
content.html: Learn about JavaScript in our JavaScript Tutorial.
